・KARAKARA2
ビジュアルノベル、KARAKARA1の続編
「2」単体でも楽しめると思いますが、前作をやればもっと楽しめます。
「1」と同じで選択肢がないため、ストーリーをひたすら読んでいくスタイルとなります。
内容も1～2時間程度で読み終わるため、空いた時間や残業帰りにプレイすると癒されます。

人類が滅び、別種族が多く存在する世界で、主人公レオンとヒロイン達がまったりほのぼのいちゃいちゃするストーリー
重婚可能な世界なため、誰か1人と付き合い他ヒロインは全員単身・・・なんて悲しい展開にはならない(はず)なので安心してください。

今回も日常パートメインでしたが、最後が気になる終わり方だったため次回作に期待。
個人的にタイトルBGMがとても好みです。落ち着いた曲調は心が安らぎますね。
レベッカお姉ちゃんがめっっっっっっっっっちゃかわいい

以下ちょっとした疑問点(ネタバレ注意)
[spoiler]4章後半でレオンとマリちゃんが××された時の2人の対応に違和感を覚えました。
なんでそんな平然といられるんだ・・・自分の命がかかってるんだぞ・・・
また、「1」からある伏線の数々が何も触れられていないため、いずれ回収してくれることを願ってます。[/spoiler]

36585738.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
KARAKARA2 is calme's second kinetic visual novel on Steam, published by Sekai Project.

KARAKARA2 is set in the same post-apocalyptic world as its predecessor, with the Earth dry and hot and the mutant human-animal population dwindling. The game directly continues the story of Leon the pure human diner owner and chef; his two live-in animal-girl employees and 'special friends', Lucia and Aisia; and the local law enforcement officer and researcher, Cullen. Leon, Lucia, and Cullen now all know Aisia's vampiric secret. Though Cullen has warned Leon to keep it secret, for fear that others wouldn't be quite so understanding, Aisia is now comfortable taking her food from her friends when she needs it, and they, in turn, are happy to help her. Life continues as normal in the diner.

This second game is again split into two stories, one for each of the two major new animal-human hybrid characters. Episode 3 (the first story) sees the refined and intelligent Rebecca Valentine appear at the door of the diner, seeking Leon's hand in marriage, while Episode 4 introduces the child-like Mari Mizuno, a self-confessed 'humble ninja', who rescues Leon and Lucia from a couple of unpleasant thugs.

Before you know it, Leon's little harem is growing even larger.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
As with the first game in the series, KARAKARA2 doesn't depart from the typical visual novel style, with two-dimensional 'paper-doll' anime characters drawn in various poses in front of static, hand-drawn backgrounds. The interface is the same as the first game, too, with an adjustable semi-transparent text box used for displaying the story a few lines at a time and a number of settings and option menus available with a button click.

The graphics are very similar to the first game, with many of the same backgrounds and mostly the same poses for returning characters. Artist "P19" returns to draw the four new characters, too, and the same art style is used. It looks good, though a bit more variation with the animal characteristics of the girls wouldn't have gone astray.

The music is more of the same, too. The number of tracks has now increased to 17, according to the unlockable sound gallery, which has also been retained from the first game. Many of them are the same as in part one, but there are half a dozen new ones, too. 

There's a new animated cutscene for the opening credits and also a brief closing credits scene, too. They don't expand the story or anything, but they're well made and help to give the game an anime TV series feel.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
As with its predecessor, KARAKARA2 plays like any other game in the genre; the game presents the story to you a few lines at a time and you click to advance the text. That's it; there are no decisions or any other gameplay elements. Again, as with the first game, it really should be tagged as a 'kinetic novel', and shouldn't include the 'nudity' or 'sexual content' tags, as the Steam version of the game doesn't include either. There's an adult patch, but it must be purchased separately from a third-party website.

The story is consistent with the first game and again is very well written from a grammar perspective. The script is a bit sillier than the first game, though, with quite a few lines of dialogue that just don't seem like something that would be said in the situation. More is revealed about the post-apocalyptic Earth and its inhabitants, though, which is definitely a good thing.

A bit more actually happens in this game than in the first, too, which is also a plus, but the characters seem to have all but forgotten about their quest from the first game: to find Aisia's parents. Perhaps there will be progress towards that end -- and the newly introduced quest for Rebecca -- in the inevitable third instalment. The story is still very short, taking somewhere between two and three hours to progress through it at a fairly slow speed. And with a fair portion of the art being reused, it seems a bit like a repeat of the first game.

Other than that, there are a couple of changes to the gameplay from the first game. For some reason, the developers haven't included Steam Achievements in KARAKARA2, which is a bit of a disappointment for any achievement hunters; and the issue I encountered often in the first game with the text stopping mid-sentence, requiring a click to continue, seems to have been resolved.

[h1]Pros and Cons[/h1]
Pros:
+ Lovely art, though a fair portion is reused from the first game
+ Interesting setting
+ Mostly likeable characters
+ Trading Cards

Cons:
- Incorrectly tagged on the Steam store page
- No choices; straight 'kinetic' novel
- No Steam achievements
- Adult patch is expensive and only available from a third-party store

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
KARAKARA2 is much the same as its predecessor. It's well written, with an interesting story, pleasant art, and likeable characters. However, it's still not really what's advertised on the Steam store page, and it's still much too short for the asking price. If you're a fan and you've been hanging out for it, then by all means pick it up; otherwise I'd suggest waiting until it's on deep discount.

A
S

Karakara2 -all ages / Steam version / kinetic novel-

Gelungene Fortsetzung von Karakara:

Bild, Musik & Vertonung sind calme wieder gelungen und überzeugen, daher ohne viele Umstände: 10/10 !

Zum Zeitpunkt der Reviewerstellung liegt die Schriftversion in Englisch, Japanisch & Chinesisch und Vertonung in Japanisch vor. Deutsch ist nicht enthalten bzw. verfügbar.

Kein besonderer Tiefgang in der Story, viel ergibt sich bzw. zeichnet sich im Verlauf ab.

36490478.review:
4.2小时，加上18补丁的全剧情以及全CG全部搞定！
关于18补丁的语音部分，目前已经补完了修复后的H场景语音，很赞！
再者，关于卢莎刚开始部分的语音，本人本着认真又严谨的态度听了一遍，可以确定的是：CV并没换人，声线还是一样的，只是语调比第1部过于粗糙了一些而已。好在后来CV好像又找回原来的感觉了，所以后面的语音问题不大了。
第2部感觉剧情上比第1部有部分升华，可以从2位新女主的剧情上面各种侧面的看见这个世界的世界观以及男主他们即将面临的危机，感觉比起1来说，2的伏笔更重。也可以从这两位新女主线里更直观的看到两位女主可爱的一面以及她们的鲜明性格，可以说感觉2里新女主的性格塑造方面比1鲜明不少，这也算是2的一个进步。也因此在2里，我对这两位新女主有着很大的好感——虽然我不是御姐控但是我还是喜欢上了善解人意的莉贝卡。
再就是关于2作的结尾......悬疑太重还有巨大的阴谋意味在里面......真的是感觉这剧情都要变成战斗向了......还有与玛丽的剧情以及那两个小反派的剧情里，或多或少的可以看到反派BOSS的伏笔。对可能要出的3来说也许是重大剧情的线索吧！
其实两位新女主的话，还是比较主推玛丽......至于为什么我就不解释了哈哈！
2部还是挺赞的！期待可能毫无音讯的steam成就+遥遥无期的3的到来！各位如果对1有爱的话就买2吧！

36462914.review:
KARAKARA2的内容相比第一部确实短了点, 加入第三第四章后也好像只是把整个故事刚刚开了个头, 登场人物全部介绍了一遍而已. 即便如此, 还是比某些本质卖图, 却硬是要做出一个游戏来恶心人的国产货色强太多了.

随着两位新人物的登场, 这个故事变得更加魔幻了. KARAKARA有一个一直没说清楚的灾难背景, 也许到最后也不会说明清楚, 但就这样下去或许也挺好的, 因为我发现自己只是想看着一个明明是后启示录却宛若童话似的日常故事一天天继续下去而已. 这次的脚本最令我意外的是, 第二部捡起了KARAKARA的世界观设定, 让我产生了它要把故事的舞台扩大的错觉, 搞得KARKARA3好像终于要进入主线一样. 虽然不知道第三部会如何将这个故事继续下去, 但还是期待的.

其他:
这次p19的作画也很稳定, 但是不知为何带给人一种摸的感觉.
开头Lucia的声线似乎有变化(跟人设对不上), 也许是录音的问题, 到第四章又完全没有这种感觉了.
R18补丁暂时有问题, 没有配音.
推土机男主是真的怪.

36443575.review:
前作的内容几乎不记得了，毕竟苦等了两年（?）的续作。然后，两年的时间你们就只做了这么一点内容？
前作的印象是，这大概就是个卖萌的故事吧，看完治愈就行了。然后续作读完，嗯，不对，这故事的发展怕是不大对劲啊。然后一看剧本作家，木緒なち...别做成致郁作啊。
本续作没有什么太多的惊喜，很多地方也是都合主義，需要什么特性就随手拿来设定。但并没有什么太大的关系，反正你们也就看看兽耳娘卖卖萌嘛。
人物上，个人依旧喜欢かわしまりの配的ルーシャ。新角色倒没什么特别喜欢的地方。我看评论里有要求关爱过气女主的呼声？[strike]  讲道理，明明ルーシャ才是正妻[/strike] 
总而言之，作为p19的死忠，肯定是第一时间买了。遗憾的是，分割商法本身没有问题，但这个续作内容真是非常少，而且拖的时间也太久了。隔壁corona blossom分割成三部完结一年内完成，连贯性也好得多。

This is just as good as the previous one. It involves some new characters so here are my opinions on them.
Rebecca is the kindest of them all and the way she acts really does make her a perfect "onee-chan" for all of them living together.
Mari looks and acts kinda cute but she's actually a really brave and modest girl. (Aisia still takes first place in cuteness in my book!)
Im really happy the developers continued the story of the first game and the ending dropped an obvious hint about a 3rd game which i'm really looking forward to.
And here are some SPOILERS so be careful for reading more of my review!!!
The time in the first game when Aisia turned out to be a vampire took me by suprise but i was kinda okay with what the developers had in mind. But when Rebecca's arm came off and afterwards she admitted that she is actually a zombie is when i lost it. It was supposed to be quite a dramatic scene but i was laughing for 5 minutes straight! Like 'Really? After a vampire you put in a zombie? What's next? An elf maybe?'
And in chapter 4 where Mari came in first just by looking at her thought 'Oh god no. What is it this time? By the looks of it she'a something like a ninja? I wonder...' and a few minutes later it turns out that i was right. 
And they ended a game with a reaaaaally big cliffhanger. A mysterious person calls Leon to tell him that Cullen ia taken hostage and he must obey (most likely) her orders (by the voice of the person and considering there have only been female characters except for Leon i assume it's a "she"). 
The ending filling me with anticipation and the need to know more about the story i am absolutely hyped for the 3rd episode to be out.

Ütopik hikayenin hazin çöküşü...

İlk hikayede dünya'nın başına gelen felaket, insanların giderek kısırlaşması üzerine hayvan genleri ile insan genleri arasında yapılan deneyler, derken erkek nüfusunun düşmesi, normal insana benzeyen insanların sayısının inanılmaz azalması gibi konularla ütopik bir giriş yapmıştık. İlk oyunun sonunda Cullen bize artık evlenme zamanımızın geldiğini söylemişti.

Evet ikinci oyunda bir evlilik bekliyordum ama neredeyse oyunun %90'ının bunun üzerine olmasınıda beklemiyordum. Yazının buradan sonrasında biraz spoiler olacaktır ! ;

Öncelikle dünya'da birdan fazla kadın ile evlenmek gelenek haline gelmiştir, çünkü erkek nüfusu ciddi bir düşüştedir. Fakat biz ahlaki değerlere saygı gösterdiğimiz için tek evlilik yapmak niyetindeyizdir ve doğru eşi bulduğumuzda evlenmeye karar vermişizdir. İlk aramıza katılan aisia vampir çıkmıştı. Şimdi aramıza ikinci katılan Rebecca zombi çıkıyor, üçüncü katılan Mali ise ninja çıkıyor. Hepsi özgeçmişlerine kısa kısa değiniyor fakat bana bu hikayeler oldukça zorlama geldi. Hani nasılsa ütopik birşey yazıyoruz bunlardan da birer tutam olsun dermişcesine hikayeye eklenmiş durumdalar. 

Ve oyundan inanılmaz bir sevgi seli akıyor. Herşeye katılan momo (köpek) ve her konuşmada birilerine sarılıp kucaklamadan duramayan rebecca, herşeye inanılmaz heyecanlanan aisia derken sevgi pıtırcıklığından içiniz kalkıyor. Aklıma Chucky filminde birbiriyle öpüşen sevgilileri görünce chucky'nin sevgilisi tifany'e "artık kusucam yeter" dediği sahne geldi en sonunda.

Neyse ki bu durumu yazarlarda farketmiş ki yazının başında kastettiğim %90'dan kalan %10'luk kısmına iki gangster karakteri eklemişler. Fakat dediğim gibi bu o kadar az olmuş ki bence hikayeyi kurtaramamış.

Bu kadar ütopik başlayıp böyle bir devama bağlanması beni hayal kırıklığına uğrattı. Ayrıca oyuna para verip alınan +18 paketinde hiçbir sevişme sahnesinin hikaye ile alakası olmaması da cabası. Üç kızla oynanan video oyununu nasıl kazanabileceğimiz üzerine tartışırken bir anda rebecca ile sex yapmaya başlıyor son sahne bitince konuşmaya kaldığı yerden devam ediyorlar. Sadece para tuzağından ibaret bir ek paket olmuş. 

Oyun süresi ilkine göre 1-2 saat kadar uzamış. Müzikler ve çizimler gene başarılıydı. Oyunun sonuda sonraki oyunun başlangıcı ile ilgili mesaj vererek bitiyor. Ama dediğim gibi pek beğenmedim.

10/4,5

40398157.review:
Difficile per me scrivere questa recensione: il primo Karakara mi è piaciuto abbastanza, ma questo seguito proprio non mi è andato giù.
Per quanto la narrativa sia sempre piacevole e i disegni molto aggraziati e in linea con il primo capitolo Karakara 2 pecca in quello che, per me, è l'aspetto fondamentale di una VN... la storia! 
Vengono introdotti due nuovi personaggi, entrambi con un passato ed entrambi discretamente caratterizzati ma la sindrome dell'harem a tutti i costi (tra l'altro non nascosta nemmeno da alcuni comprimari come battuta) è pesante e banalizza tutte le costruzioni seriose fatte sul background... il finale poi lascia troppo appesi e troppo presto!
Gli asset sono riciclati per una buona metà e le CG nuove sono legate giusto al nuovo cast, la colonna sonora non aggiunge alcun pezzo memorabile e, come scritto poco sopra, la storia non avanza abbastanza per lasciare soddisfatti dopo le 2-3 ore scarse di lettura (non ci sono scelte come nel primo episodio)... 
Peccato, il cliffhanger lascia sperare che ci sia qualcosa di più che non un Nekopara ambientato in una città post olacausto, ma sono rimasto comunque deluso dalla qualità del prodotto finale, spero si riprenda con Karakara 3 perché altrimenti quanto di buono è stato introdotto con il primo episodio rimarrà lettera morta.
Consigliato solo in bundle, se avete comprato il primo, e se lo trovate ad un buon prezzo...

40273846.review:
KARAKARA 2 continues right after the first one and lots of exactly the same art and music is being used again, as well as a couple of new visuals and audio tracks in the same style. Supposed you played / read the first part (which you definitely should have before taking on this one, for obvious reasons!), you will feel right at home, even though it could have been just a DLC instead of a true sequel as well.
The length is about the same as the first one, maybe a tiny bit longer.

Two new characters are introduced and even though I found Rebecca a bit bland and boring at first, there are some revelations and character developments that make her a lot more interesting later on and she fits right in.
Mari, who appears in the second half, is a fun and likeable character again and it's mostly because of her the game vecomes even more cringeworthy as the first one and becomes downright hilarious.
Oh, and Momo (the dog) finally has more screentime now as well. :)

Overall, there's even more (likeable) silliness than in the first one, and it is yet again very uplifting and positive in tone. However, by the time of the cliffhanger ending, quite a couple of storylines are hanging in the open without having been resolved.
If you enjoyed the first one, you will also like this one, even though it's just more of the same and there's no appropiate closure this time around.

That said, I can't wait for a third part which will hopefully be able to put a satisfying end to some story arcs instead of just throwing even more new characters at us yet again.

40098915.review:
A visual novel that you can complete within 2 hours for those who have some money lying around.

It's the continuation of the original KARAKARA and I've got to say, it's pretty enjoyable.

While it is short, the art work is great, and the UI is clean, just like in the original.
There is no choices though so if you're looking for that type of VN, this isn't it. Besides, this is an All-Ages VN either way.
(Though, that doesn't mean that 18+ scenes aren't in here, just that it requires a patch.)

I would recommend to those who seem interested in playing this to get the original first. You would understand the story a more better if you did.

Overall Rating: 8/10

39856683.review:
Rating: 6/10 ("Decent")

Recommended for: People who enjoy VNs, people who enjoy slice of life. Play this if you liked the Nekopara series or if you liked the previous game, KARAKARA.

KARAKARA 2 is a short visual novel with approximately 3 hours' reading time. There are no choices to make. It picks up directly after the ending of KARAKARA, so you should read that VN first before playing this.

The game is set some time in the distant future, where "normal" humans are mainly gone from the picture, replaced instead with people that possess four ears, and, occasionally, a tail. Like the previous game, KARAKARA 2's plot is mainly character-driven; this time, the main driving force of the plot is the issue of who the main character, Leon, will get married to. As usual, he's fine for a main character. Mari and Rebecca are decent additions to the cast; I liked Rebecca the most.

The artwork is still pretty and of high quality. We have several new characters to add to the line up, including Rebecca and Mari. CGs are very nice, though there are still some problems regarding wonky-looking anatomy at times.

The soundtrack is the same as the previous game, and so there's not much to right home about. It's still perfectly serviceable.

Overall, KARAKARA 2 is a sweet slice of life novel, though it feels a little boring compared to the previous game. It ends on a cliffhanger, so it's pretty much a given that I'll have to pick up the third game at some point; but I wouldn't recommend getting it at full price.
